intro: Opulaster australis, commonly known as the Australian opulaster, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in heathland and coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and leathery, and it produces small, clustered flowers in shades of white and pink. Opulaster australis is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
